item.title: Using the jaeger agent as a sidecar process in ECS
item.description: When deploying a microservice on Amazon ECS that you want to trace with jaeger, it may not be immediately clear how to package the jaeger agent as a sidecar process with your service. I’m not sure that what I’ve used is a recommended practice but has worked well thus far. The bash script below starts the jaeger agent in the background, then starts the service you want to run in the background as well, listening for while listening for SIGTERM or SIGINT.
